page.title: 14ANGUS HEATHERS
page.content: For nine years now{ANGUS HEATHERS has been a great attraction for visitors to Letham. Mr & Mrs Sturrock who own the heather farm are busy every week-end and busiest during Bank Holidays and over Easter and the May Week-end. They employ four permanent workers and take on casual workers when necessary. The owners had been surprised to find that "Lucky White Heather" on sale to tourists at Inverness Castle had come from Surrey in England, so on retiring from his job as an Income Tax Inspector, Mr Sturrock decided to begin Heather Farming which was a new idea at the time. They have 140 varieties of heathers for sale but do not send orders by post and cannot export heathers unless they are inspected for diseases first.
